instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message: Have this board that once it goes into sleep, the display won't come back on unto i reboot, but external display works just fine. Even after i unplug from the external display, the internal display never comes back on until reboot. No sure if this is related, but also noticed the internal display never goes off when the lid is closed. Any suggestions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
Usually Hall sensors issue.
We discussed a lot on the forum about such problem.
Inspect J5250/60 for corrosion; also check <RESISTOR>R5252</RESISTOR>/53.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
No sign of corrosion. Inspected J520/60 and also <RESISTOR>R5252</RESISTOR>/53.

With Lid open TP[1]<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> reads 3.4v, once closed it changes to 0.0v but the display remains on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
What about left sensor?
Check the reaction at <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> I/O pins.
Be sure all its related resistors are good; as traces and solders too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message: Left sensor is also responding the same, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT_R</SIGNAL> 3.4v open and 0.0v once close. Same result with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>. Another thing i just notice is with the display. After a restart, the display would start flickering on and off every 10 or so seconds. This issue isn't always present after restart of the mac

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
Been a while. Finally got this unit back. Anyway, same issue. I went ahead and recalled the smc with the same result.
Recap on what have been done so far:
No sign of corrosion. Inspected J520/60 and also <RESISTOR>R5252</RESISTOR>/53.
With Lid open TP[1]<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> reads 3.4v, once closed it changes to 0.0v but the display remains on. Left sensor responding the same as the right. 
Swapped the display as well. 

Any other suggestions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>: 3.4v open and 0.0v once close.

But the issue is present even when I don’t close the lid, when it goes to sleep.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
Discard a software issue first.
Test with USB macOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Display won't come back on from sleep
threads.message:
Realized i never updated  on progress. New OS fixed it. 

Thanks.
